Sus sueños es,  tener su propia empresa de transporte de moto taxis y así poder tener más personas trabajando y obtener más ganancias y más ingresos para su familia y quiere que sus  hijos se preparen mucho.
texts.en:
Juan is a 27-year-old man who studied up to the 9th grade.  He's a father of 3 children, a 6-year-old and 5-month-old twins.  He's accompanied by his wife who takes care of the domestic chores.  

Juan has worked as a driver of motorcycle taxis for the last 4 years.  He learned the business with the help of his mother-in-law who bought him 2 motorcycle taxis so that he could work.  He has routes throughout his municipality.  

With the loan requested at Fundación Campo he will buy 10 bags of cement and bricks to improve his house.  This loan will greatly improve his life because with this money he will prepare his house so that his children can have a good roof over their heads.  

His dream is to have his own transportation business of motorcycle taxis to be able to have more people working and generate more earnings and income for his family.  He wants his children to study a lot.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of cement and bricks to improve his house.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María de 54 años de edad, casada con hijos mayores de edad, es originaria de la zona central del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Desde muy joven se casó y ha tenido que trabajara para ayudar con la económica del hogar y apoyar a sus hijos que se superen y tenga mejores condiciones de vida.
Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos comestibles en un quiosco ubicado en un lugar específico de la localidad. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo reposterías, frescos, gaseosas, sanwind, churritos, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos. El objetivo del crédito es invertiré en capital de trabaja y aprovechar la temporada navideña donde las ventas se incrementan y así en  un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old. She is married with children who are adults. She is originally from the central area of the country. She distinguishes herself as a responsible worker with a desire for self-improvement. She married very young and has had to work to help with the household expenses, and to support her children so they can improve and have better living conditions.

Thanks to her effort and desire to succeed, she sells foods at a kiosk located in a specific location of the neighborhood. For 12 hours a day she sells pastries, natural beverages, soft drinks, sandwiches, churros, candies, and juices. 

The purpose of the loan is for working capital and to take advantage of the Christmas season when sales increase. That way in the not-too-distant future she can obtain a better income.  María is grateful for the assistance that Kiva investors provide so that people with limited resources and from poorer countries like Nicaragua can have the means for decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and supply her business with foods such as pastries, natural beverages, soft drinks, sandwiches, churros, candies, and juices.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
This is Regina. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to pay for additional gowns and barong tagalog (an embroidered formal shirt from the Philippines) to expand her inventory. More items to sell will result in better profits. She still sells mineral water and the loan will also be useful there. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Regina dreams of having her own stall in the market, so that her gowns will be easily seen.  She hopes that her whole family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional gowns and barong tagalog (an embroidered formal shirt from the Philippines) to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
This is Aurora, 53, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Fernando, a policeman, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Aurora operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Aurora dreams that her business will flourish and hopes that her family will always be in good condition.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and where she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina. She previously accessed an 60,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy beverages and other products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy beverages and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josefina hopes that her business will run smoothly and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets every week with her co-fellowship members,* to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beverages and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y tres hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Rafael, an enterprising man, is 39 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children.  He is currently requesting a loan in hopes of buying supplies, such as fertilizers and fumigants.  He wants to maintain his coffee crops so he can keep them in good condition during their development and obtain high quality produce.  This gentleman's only limitation to continued growth is a lack of money, as they depend on this business to be able to get ahead.  This is why he is asking for this loan and it is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He has not taken out loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with greater credit facilities and a much lower interest rate….

loans.use: to buy  supplies such as fertilizers and fumigants.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 56 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 10 years. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall. In the future, Geraldine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her vegetable stall.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods to sell in her store.

She has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as bath soap, sugar, shampoo, candles, bread, soft drinks, canned goods and other groceries. Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman is a freshman in the Psychology program. This is his story:

I have always been interested psychology. I have read a lot of books concerning the human psyche and behavior, and found them deeply fascinating. Specifically, it was the work written by Erich Fromm that ignited my aspiration to study psychology.

I believe that there are a lot of prospects for a young psychologist today, because there are always new things being discovered about the human mind and how it works. I would like to work in the future to help people overcome the problems that make their lives more difficult, and help us build a strong society in Kyrgyzstan.

I want to study at the American University of Central Asia because the university is able to provide its students with a high quality education that meets modern standards. Students come from all over the world to study here, and I will be surrounded by people from different cultural backgrounds. I am also glad about the fact that most subjects will be taught in English language. It will give me a remarkable opportunity to enhance my language skills. I can say for certain that the American University of Central Asia is the perfect place to expand my intellectual horizons and achieve great things.

loans.use: to pay for his higher education.

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en:
Sughra is 45 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the family's needs. Therefore, Sughra started her own business to contribute to the family's income. 

She has been operating a business selling bangles for many years. She buys bangles from the wholesale markets at lower rates, and then sells them to the people of her community at a profit. 

Sughra has requested a loan to buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs. This will help her to increase her sales. 

She wants to expand her business to provide a better standard of living for her family.

Sughra thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy the latest variety of bangles in different colors and designs

loans.name: Guadalupe Del Carmen

texts.es: Guadalupe de 43 años de edad se dedica a la venta de pan dulce y pan francés desde hace varios años, posee mucha clientela por ser un producto muy vendible, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijo, Guadalupe esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de pan dulce y frances por mayor y asi seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su esposo.
texts.en: Guadalupe is 43 years old and has been selling sweet breads and baguettes for many years. She has many clients because she sells a very popular product. With her sales, she wants to solve some home expenses. She lives in her own home with her husband and her son. Guadalupe seeks a loan to buy more sweet breads and baguettes to continue her work and help her increase her profits to have a better quality of life for her and her husband.

loans.use: to buy sweet breads and baguettes for resale

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gregoria is 43 years old and has two children who are still in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and has been in this business for 3 years. 

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional box of fish to sell to her customers. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Gregoria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional box of fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jarelyn

texts.en:
Jarelyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old and has three children who are in school. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and she has been in this business for 4 years. 

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall. In the future, Jarelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 59 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. Juliet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like canned goods, bread, noodles, eggs, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell. Juliet has been in this business for 13 years and would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like canned goods, bread, noodles, eggs, detergent soap, fabric conditioner, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
Lovelyn works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. Lovelyn has been in this business for six years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Lovelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Demia

texts.es: Denia  tiene la edad de 48 años, está casada y vive con el esposo y un hijo actualmente. Ella el  crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono, herbicidas para  dar asistencia a una siembra de frijoles que quieren iniciar y a la vez ayudarse con la mano de obra. Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Denia is 48 years old, married, and lives with her husband and son. The loan she is seeking is to buy fertilizer and herbicides and improve the condition of her bean farm she and her husband wish to start and help with labor. Denia wants to look after the plants well so that she gets good production and earns more money.

She hopes to provide her family with a better standard of living in the future and a more stable income. Then she will be able to continue making progress both as a person and a coffee producer.

This is Denia's first loan with FUDECOSUR, nor has she had any with other banks in the past. FUDECOSUR is offering the easiest terms and the lowest interest rates.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to help grow beans

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell tobacco business in the Philippines. Luciana requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more tobacco to sell.  She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Luciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Doña Cruz es una mujer con muchas fuerzas, muchos ánimos y esperanzas de salir adelante y de cumplir lo propuesto en su vida manifestando a sus 53 años la gratitud y el respeto hacia sus padres por haber inculcado en ella valores, principios que son la base de la superación y prosperidad en la vida. Ella es casada y madre de 4 hijos quienes apoyan a sus padres en las diferentes actividades del campo como la limpieza, aplicación de abono, recolección del grano etc. Desde hace más de 17 años practica la agricultura en compañía de su esposo a quien ella agradece el apoyo incondicional por los muchos años juntos como equipo de trabajo y en su matrimonio. Sus cultivos están ubicados en su misma comunidad a la cual se trasladan caminando aproximadamente a medio kilómetros de distancia. Doña Cruz no tiene ningún grado de educación por lo que hoy en día se esmera y se esfuerza diariamente para que su familia tenga más oportunidades en la vida e incrementar el patrimonio familiar. 
Ella tiene como meta elaborar una pequeña remodelación a su casa de habitación la cual necesita unas mejoras, apoyar a su familia en todo lo necesario y demás que ellos necesiten y ella pueda ayudar. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas, etc. que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
Cruz is a woman with a lot of strength, energy and hopes of getting ahead and completing her life's purpose. At 53 years of age, she expresses gratitude and respect for her parents for having instilled in her values and principles, which are the base of excelling and prospering in life.

She is married and is mother to 4 children, who support their parents in various activities in the field, such as cleaning, application of compost, harvesting the beans, etc. For more than 17 years, she has been working in agriculture with her husband, to whom she is grateful for the unconditional support during their many years together as a work team and in their marriage.

Her crops are located in the same community to which they walk approximately half a kilometer.

Cruz does not have any education, which is why she now takes great pains and works hard every day so that her family can have more opportunities in life and to increase the family inheritance.

She has as her goal to undertake a small-scale remodeling of her house, which needs some improvements, and to support her family in everything they need and that she can provide. That is why she is now applying for a loan with which she will improve her crops, giving them better attention by applying agricultural inputs such as compost, fertilizer, coffee formula, fungicides, etc., that will avoid contamination by insects and sicknesses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to tend to and maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Nolvia Marisela

texts.es:
Nolvia es una joven de 22 años con un grado de estudio de secundaria completa de la cual pudo graduarse como bachiller en ciencias y letras y técnico en computación gracias al apoyo incondicional de sus padres a quien ella admira y respeta mucho. Ella se encuentra en un estado civil unión libre y su pareja trabaja como docente en una escuela de la comunidad el cual apoya a su compañera de hogar en lo necesario e indispensable para su bienestar y el de ellos como familia. Nolvia es una joven con mucho Ímpetu y visión empresarial deseando sacarle provecho a su carrera ya que ella mientras fue estudiante vio la necesidad de un centro de cómputo e imprenta para trabajos profesionales y demás que los estudiantes buscan en todo tiempo. 
Por lo que ella ha decidido como joven emprendedora iniciar un pequeño negocio de imprenta habiendo identificado la necesidad en su comunidad por medio de sus vecinos, estudiantes, amigos y demás que requieren de un trabajo profesional y presentable.             
Sus metas y planes extender su negocio e incluir no solo el trabajo de imprenta si no también la venta de maquinaria como (computadoras, impresoras, teclados, discos duros, etc.) que generen un mayor ingreso a su negocio y una mayor demanda para el mismo. Sus sueños con el tiempo comprar o construir su propio local donde no tenga que alquilar para ver el patrimonio para sus futuros hijos como los de construir su propia casa de habitación.
texts.en:
After finishing high school, Nolvia, 22, received her college degree in science and letters and a technical degree in computers with the unconditional support of her parents, whom she admires and respects. Nolvia is in a common-law marriage, and her husband teaches at a local school to help his wife provide everything needed for the family's well being. Nolvia has drive and an entrepreneur's vision and wants to take advantage of her degree, as she noticed as a student the need for a computer and printing center for working professionals and other things the students looked for constantly. 

Therefore, this young entrepreneur has decided to open a small printing business, after identifying the local need through neighbors, students, friends, and others who require professional work. Her goals and plans are to grow her business to include not only printing, but also equipment sales (computers, printers, keyboards, hard drives. etc.) that would generate more business income and more demand. She dreams of eventually buying and building out a space so that she doesn't have to rent and could build her future children's assets by building her own house.

loans.use: to buy printing equipment to start her own business.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 34-year-old lady living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to make some savings so she could provide better facilities to her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income. 

Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years with irregularities because most of the time his rickshaw remains out of order. He has to maintain the auto rickshaw but his earnings and savings do not allow him to do this. 

Therefore, Rubina requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to repair the auto rickshaw and could drive it with regularity. She hopes her husband would be able to generate a reasonable income and she would be able to make enough savings. She thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair an auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a 37-year-old married woman living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a milkman by profession. He sells milk in his nearby community and gets a reasonable income for his family. He purchases milk from wholesalers and sells it as a retailer over his shop. He wants to offer yogurt according to the demand but he does not have money to buy more milk for the production of yogurt.

Therefore, Munira requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to purchase more fresh milk for the production of yogurt to sell. Munira hopes that she would be able to make some savings with the amount of profit. She thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more milk for the production of yogurt to sell.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Narcisa es hija única, actualmente está culminando sus estudios de ingeniería comercial, comenta que también trabaja en una farmacia, también realiza decoración de eventos. Es una persona muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante.
Aparte de trabajar está estudiando arduamente ya que quiere poder sobresalir, ya que sabe que la forma de ser alguien en la vida es estudiando.
Pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en sus gastos de titulación, ya que son muchos gastos que debe cubrir, y son un poco costosos.
texts.en: Narcisa is an only child. She is completing her commercial engineering studies. She comments that she also works in a pharmacy and also does event decorating. She is a fighter who wants to succeed. Besides her work she is studying hard as she wants to stand out. She knows that you have to study if you want to be somebody. She is requesting this loan to invest in the costs of graduating as there are a lot of expenses and they are somewhat expensive.

loans.use: to pay for graduation.

loans.name: Ha's Group

texts.en:
Ha is 40 years old. She has four children. All of them are still going to school. The oldest daughter is learning in high school and the youngest son is in kindergarten. Her husband is working for the national army. Every month, he earns about 5,000,000 VND. Ha is a cook. Her monthly income is 3,000,000 VND. Ha’s family total income is around 8,000,000 VND. Her dream is that her children would receive a good education and better living conditions. 

Thus, to increase the family income, Ha wants to borrow 6,322,000 to invest in feeding chickens. This is the second time Ha has participated in the SEDA program. Realizing the economic benefit from farming poultry, this time Ha will continue to borrow money to invest in raising chickens. 
Other members in Ha’s group are listed below:

•	Hoa who is 38 years old wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in her Vietnamese traditional sausage stall.
•	Ly is 36 years old. She has two children. She would love to borrow 8,066,000 VND to develop her fish shop.
•	Van is 34 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow to spend on her coffee shop.
•	Dao is 34 years old. She would love to borrow to invest in her family business which is transportation services.

loans.use: to invest in raising chickens.

loans.name: Liezlgin

texts.en:
Liezlgin works hard to support two children. She is married and has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 7,500 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Liezlgin is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Ma. Rosabelle

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Ma. Rosabelle works hard to support her family. She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. Ma. Rosabelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 31-year-old, married man, and a father of two children. They live in Ibb, Yemen. He is a doctor of pharmacology science. He has been operating a pharmacy for a few months. He started his career by training in another pharmacy in order to get more experience, then trying to get a job. He strove as much as possible to get a job in a company, and then he tried to accumulate money with which to open his own pharmacy, but unfortunately he couldn't.  He took a loan of 200,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB. He is using the loan in order to supply his business with good medicines and keep his customers coming back. In the future, he would like to expand his business and open another pharmacy.

loans.use: to stock his business with good medicines and keep his customers coming back.

loans.name: Adrian Elpidio

texts.es:
Adrian es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
Adrian tiene 52 años, esta casado y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de el.  Vive en casa de familiares y se dedica a ser taxista desde hace 13 años. Tiene dos taxis de los cuales el maneja uno y tiene otro que se lo da a otra persona para que lo maneje. Adrian esta solicitando el prestamo para poder terminar el tramite de las placas para uno de los taxis y de esta forma tendrá todo regularizado y podrá mejorar sus ingresos y darle una mejor calidad de vida a mi familia

Para Adrian, sus principales logros son que anteriormente era chofer de transporte público y cuando lo liquidaron decidió invertir en un taxi, con su trabajo ha podido dar una calidad de vida mejor a su familia y ahora ya tiene dos taxis, su reto es llegar ha tener mas taxis.
texts.en:
Adrian is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

I am Adrian. I’m 52 years old and I’m married and have 5 children, one of which is dependent. I live in my relatives' home and I have been a taxi driver for 13 years. I have two taxis, one I drive one and the other I give to another person to work. 

Now I’m requesting a loan to be able to finish the paperwork for a license plate on one of the taxis and this way I will have everything legalized and I will be able to improve my income and give my family a better quality of life.

My achievements is that I was a public transportation driver and when I was laid off, I invested in a taxi. With my job I have been able to provide a better quality of life for my family and I now have two taxis. My goal is to have more taxis.

loans.use: to complete the paperwork and obtain a license plates for my taxi.

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Luis, es un microempresario de 27 años de edad, dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente, desde hace 5 años posee una tienda de alquiler y venta de películas, además presta el servicio de café internet, fotocopiado e impresión de documentos y complementa los servicios con la venta de mecato, dulces y gaseosas; la idea surgió de su pasión por el cine y vio en esto una ventaja muy favorable, pues no cuenta con competencia directa en el sector; de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para llevar el sustento a su hogar donde vive con su esposa. 
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para realizar mantenimiento y actualización a los equipos de cómputo que posee, comprar un computador, comprar 3 cámaras para el sistema de seguridad y sacar publicidad, esto le permitirá acreditar aún más su negocio y estará un poco más protegido con el nuevo sistema que desea adquirir, además con la publicidad se dará a conocer en otros sectores aledaños, lo que le abrirá la posibilidad de atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar sus ventas. 
Luis manifiesta que su proyecto para un futuro cercano es seguir posicionando su negocio para que sea más rentable y, le permita cumplir el sueño de abrir otras sucursales, además desea comprar una casa propia para ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones de vida y disfrutar un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
Luis, a small business owner of 27 years, makes his living as an independent entrepreneur. For the last 5 years, he has owned a video rental and sale store. In addition, he offers the following services: internet café, photocopies, document printing. He complements the services with the sale of snacks, sweets and soda. This came from his passion for film and he saw a favorable opportunity in this, as there is no direct competition in the sector. In this manner, he generates sufficient resources in order to bring sustenance to his home where he lives with his wife.

With the enthusiasm of strengthening his business, he is applying for the help of this loan to maintain and update the computers he owns, buy a computer, buy 3 security cameras and buy advertising. This will let him position his business even more in the market, and he will be a little more protected with the new system he wishes to acquire. Additionally, the advertising will make him known in other nearby areas, which will open the possibility of attracting new clients and improving his sales.

Luis says that his project for the near future is to continue positioning his business so that it is more profitable. This will permit him to achieve the dream of opening other branches. In addition, he wishes to buy his own house to offer his family better living conditions and enjoy a better wellbeing.

loans.use: to maintain and update the computers he owns, buy a computer, buy 3 security cameras and take out advertising.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 36-year-old, married woman living with her spouse and six children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a butcher shop; he earns insufficient income for his family. His daily practice is to buy beef from the market and sell it from his butcher shop. Recently he spent a huge part of his income to pay utility bills, which decreased his purchasing power to buy new inventory for his butcher shop. Therefore, Zakia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a bull calf for getting beef. Zakia wants to provide higher education for her children. She dreams to provide all facilities of life for her children. 
She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a bull calf for getting beef to sell in the butcher shop.

loans.name: Dúo Lesli Group

texts.es: Dúo Lesli Doña Ana se ha distinguido en su negocio porque ofrece a sus  clientes productos venta de ropa para dama, caballero y de niño o niña, también en su domicilio  cuenta con su  venta de consumo diario, venta de regalos para toda ocasión,  piñatas, venta de cosméticos y perfumería, venta de medicina, doña Ana  necesita de  capital para invertir y seguir surtiendo en  los  diversos productos que ella ofrece ya que con lo que recupera de ganancias ayuda con los gastos de su hogar, esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Lesli Duo: Doña Ana has made a name for herself in her business because she offers her customers products such as clothing for ladies, men, and boys and girls.  From her home, she also sells basic necessities, gifts for all occasions, piñatas, cosmetics and perfume, and medicine.  Doña Ana needs money to invest and keep these various items that she sells in stock.  With what she earns, she helps take care of the household expenses.  She is hoping that you can help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria manages a piggery business in their village. Her husband is a farmer engaged in growing of rice and corn on their farm. While managing their piggery business, Victoria is also doing hair cutting, hair curling, pedicure and manicure in their village. Due to her performance in doing well her task, she encourages more customers to become her regular customers. Victoria wants to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy hair coloring, nail polish, cuticle remover and other related materials needed to perform her beauty parlor business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to run her beauty parlor business.

loans.name: Rosa Amelida

texts.es:
Rosa de 52 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, mujer que se esfuerza día con día para sacar adelante a su numerosa familia. Con mucho esfuerzo logro cursar 4° grado de educación básica, posteriormente se casó y formo su familia, su esposo trabaja como vigilante en una granja de pollos de la zona. El pago que este recibe por su trabajo no es suficiente para la manutención de su familia, teniendo doña Rosa que buscar formas de llevar ingresos a su hogar. De los 12 hijos que tienen, actualmente solamente viven 7 con ellos, el resto ya formo su hogar.
Estos 7 hijos se encuentran estudiando y además de ellos están a cargo dos nietos de la señora.

Rosa  además de dedicarse al cuido de sus hijos y realización de oficios domésticos,  atiende una pequeña pupuseria todos los días de la semana, por las tardes. Tiene 2 años de experiencia en el negocio y le ayudan sus hijos, esto cuando salen de clases en las tardes.
Anteriormente, se dedicaba a la crianza de gallina ponedora y cerdos. También le ayudaba a su marido a trabajar la tierra.

El crédito lo necesita, para comprar dos terneras que le venden, pero que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero para aprovechar la oportunidad de invertir,  el ganado se lo dan a bajo precio comparado al precio del mercado, por eso se ha decidido a solicitar financiamiento mediante un crédito. Si compra este ganado, podrá obtener ganancias de esta actividad al venderla posteriormente a un mejor precio.

Su sueño es que a su familia no le falte nada, que mediante actividades productivas puedan tener el sustento diario, y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas.
texts.en:
Rosa, 52 years of age, is an entrepreneurial woman who strives every day to make her large family prosper. Through her efforts she managed complete grade 4 of basic education. She later got married and started a family. 

Her husband works as a watchman on a chicken farm in the area. His salary is not sufficient to maintain the family and, as a result, Rosa must find ways to earn an income. 

Of the 12 children they have, only 7 live with them currently. The remaining children already have their own families. These 7 children currently attend school. Rosa also takes care of her two grandchildren. 

In addition to taking care of her children and doing household chores, Rosa works at a small grocery store 7 days a week in the afternoon. She has worked there for 2 years and her children help her in the afternoon after school. Before this, she earned a living raising hens and pigs. She also used to help her husband farm. 

She needs the loan to buy two calves that someone wants to sell her. She currently does not have the money to take advantage of this opportunity to invest. The livestock is being sold at a lower than market price, which is why she has decided to apply for a loan. If she buys this livestock, she will profit from the purchase by later selling them at a higher price. 

Her dream is for her family to have its needs met and to have daily sustenance through daily work.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 53-year-old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from seven to twenty years. He describes himself to be trustworthy and disciplined. 

Charles operates a motor vehicle repair business and he has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are motor vehicle owners. 

Charles will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy tools and materials for repairing vehicles. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand and diversify. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy tools and materials for repairing vehicles

loans.name: Shaghufta

texts.en:
Shaghufta is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been running an academy for many years. She has gained a good number of students and is respected a lot in her community. She is contributing much to the family income through all of her great efforts. She is working hard to meet the needs of her two children. 

In order to accommodate more students in her academy, Shaghufta has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase a couple of benches and chairs along with a new black board. She expects more admissions as her academy becomes famous in her town and she desires to spend part of the revenues on the expansion of it.

loans.use: to purchase a couple of benches and chairs along with a new black board

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina works hard to support her family. She is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business. She has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe is 53 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, canned goods, etc. Ma. Fe has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from sugarcane farming. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Lynie

texts.en: Lynie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 21,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more fish to sell to customers. Lynie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is re-listing Lynie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Haidilita

texts.en: Haidilita is 31 years old and married with four children. With all her children in school, Haidilita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, sugar, soft drinks, canned goods, and other groceries. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Haidilita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ma. Snooky

texts.en:
Ma. Snooky is 40 years old and married with four children.  With three children still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.  Ma. Snooky runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like cereals, chocolate drinks, cooking oil, noodles, hair conditioner, shampoo, etc. to sell.  Ma. Snooky has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of such items. 

In the future, Ma. Snooky would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like cereals, chocolate drinks, cooking oil, noodles, hair conditioner, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Manuela works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell feeds business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Manuela is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more sacks of feeds to sell for her buy and sell feeds business.

Manuela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of feeds to sell

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. Marina is married and has a food/snack vending business in the Philippines.

Marina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more biscuits, snack foods and frozen foods for her business.

Marina has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Marina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, snack foods and frozen foods for her business

loans.name: Pinnie

texts.en:
Pinnie is 47 years old, married, with two children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Pinnie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Pinnie requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

Pinnie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Pinnie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy fish to sell to customers.

Gloria successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Gloria's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en:
Ponciana is 75 years old and married with eleven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ponciana has a blacksmith business in the Philippines. Ponciana requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ponciana has been in this business for 16 years. Ponciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Ma. Teresita

texts.en:
This is Ma. Teresita, 58, a resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Domingo and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Teresita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ma. Teresita hopes to have a grocery store someday and dreams that her family will have a better standard of living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Donata

texts.en:
This is Donata. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Donata hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her youngest child will finish his studies. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the 'Word of God' she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jeraldine

texts.en: Jeraldine is 21 years old and still single. Her parents are her motivational guide, and she works hard to give them a better quality of life. She has been running her general store for three years. The daily net profits of  PHP 500 are just enough to cover the cost of the family's daily meals. Thus, she is thankful for having other sources of income aside from retailing: she also buys and sells a variety of fish. To improve her income in the store, Jeraldine is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional stock of items such as biscuits, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar and other ingredients to sell.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem, age 38, is a married woman. She has been running a business manufacturing shoes with the support of her son. She has become famous in her community and makes a good amount of income to bear their household expenditures.  

Shameem is the mother of six children and is able to fulfill their basic necessities including food, health and education. By the support of Kashf Foundation she is successfully running her business. Now, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as leather, artificial leather and plastic soles along with packs of thread etc. In this way she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and that will help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as leather, artificial leather and plastic soles along with packs of threads etc.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 24-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason Sumaira has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. 

Sumaira intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so that she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Aasia

texts.en:
Aasia is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been doing business of hand embroidery with the support of her husband who is also shown in the photo. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, Aasia has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy reels of thread along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread along with packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en: Anna Marie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. She has been in this business for 17 years now. Anna Marie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 57 years old and has one child who is still in school. Carmen has a business direct-selling Avon products in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more lotion, body soap, lipstick, shampoo and other products to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Carmen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
Angelyn is 27 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Angelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Angelyn runs a general store in the Philippines; she has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cream, cereals, shampoo, noodles, soft-drinks, and juice. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of items to sell.

Angelyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more general store items to sell

loans.name: Jenipher

texts.en:
Jenipher is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Jenipher is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her bakery for her bakery business.

Jenipher has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bakery.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
Ángela, con 41 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y cabeza de hogar desde que enfrentó el difícil momento de la separación de su esposo. Desde hace 15 años, se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una sala de belleza que inició como alternativa para generar recursos que le permitieran velar por el bienestar de sus hijos, trabaja sola todos los días de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm, la actividad la aprendió tomando clases en una academia de belleza y poco a poco fue adquiriendo más conocimientos y perfeccionando sus técnicas, lo que le ha permitido darse a conocer en el sector por la calidad de su servicio. 
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar un juego de muebles para sala de espera, un módulo de trabajo y los diferentes utensilios e insumos al por mayor (tratamientos capilares, tinturas, shampoo, acondicionador, entre otros), así estará en la capacidad de generar un empleo directo y además podrá prestar un mejor servicio, pues los clientes estarán más cómodos, lo que le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y los ingresos que percibe.
Ángela con su perseverancia y proyección hacia un futuro, desea hacer crecer su salón de belleza, en el que pueda generar más oportunidades de empleo para madres cabezas de familia, dando como resultado un mejor bienestar no sólo para su familia, sino que aportará para que otras personas puedan disfrutar de mejores condiciones para vivir.
texts.en:
Ángela, 41, is the mother of two children and the head of household since the time she faced the difficult moment of separating from her husband. For the last 15 years, she has worked in her own business; a beauty salon. She started it as an alternative to generate resources that would permit her to ensure the wellbeing of her children. She works alone every day from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM. She learned this activity taking classes in a beauty academy and, little by little, she went acquiring more knowledge and perfecting her techniques. This has allowed her to become known in the sector for her quality of service.

Currently, she is applying for the support of the loan to buy a furniture set for the waiting room, a work station and different utensils and materials in bulk (hair treatments, dyes, shampoo, conditioner, among others). In this way, she will have the capacity to generate a direct employee and she will also be able to provide a better service. The customers will be more comfortable, which will help her improve her sales and income that she perceives.

Ángela, with her perseverance and projection towards a future, wishes to make her beauty salon grow. With this, she can generate more work opportunities for single mothers. As a result she will give a better wellbeing not only for her family, but she will also give support so that other people can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a furniture set for a waiting room, a work station and different utensils and materials in bulk.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 48-year-old widow living with her two children in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son bakes bread, biscuits, cakes, rusks, etc. at home and sells his wares to bakeries. When her husband was alive, he ran the business; now her son has taken over.

Due to inflation the price of his baking ingredients has increased beyond what he can afford to pay. Therefore, Parveen applied for a 30,000 PKR loan through BRAC Pakistan for her son so that he could buy needed inventory in bulk for his baked goods.

Parveen wants to thank Kiva because its loan has given her son hope that he can turn his business around.

loans.use: to help her son buy the needed ingredients for his baked goods.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth works hard to support her family. Elizabeth is married and has an internet/gaming cafe business in the Philippines.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional unit for her business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 7 years now.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional game unit for her business

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 8500 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Irenea has been in this business for five years. Irenea also earns income from fish vending.

Irenea has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Sanila

texts.en:
Sanila is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of a son. 

She has a job in a school as an art teacher; she teaches stitching techniques to the students. She is expert in stitching fine clothes, so she decided to teach her arts to the girls in school. In this way she is enabling herself to get more income and spread his arts to others. She wants to open tailoring school at home as well.

Due to lack of funds, however, she is unable teach her students because she does not have enough stitching machines for practice. She contacted BRAC Pakistan for a loan so that she can buy a sewing machine for students to practice. It’s her third year with BRAC Pakistan and she has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for her Tailoring school.

loans.name: Santi Pala Group

texts.en:
Wayan, 49, is married and lives in a village in western Bali. He has a son who is grown and married. He is the leader of this loan group that has taken out and successfully repaid previous loans.

The good news from this group is that during the period of their previous loan, the weather was good. The members were able to plant their gardens with a variety of crops such as maize, cassava, chilli and some rice. Harvests were very good. One member left the group, as he realized enough of a profit not to have to take out another loan.

The members of Santi Pala estimate the weather will still be good in the next six months, so they have decided to apply for a 20,500,000 IDR to be apportioned among themselves. It will be used to buy seeds and fertilizers and on plant maintenance costs. Wayan himself will also use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. He hopes for a good harvest and to be able to save some of his profits. (Note: One member of the group could not attend due to a religious ceremony at the temple.)

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is 48 years old and the mother of five children. She has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. 

With the passage of time, her sales and her income increased. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. 

Bashiran helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her tenth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida, 43, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals such as baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them and sells them on the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

Sajida needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she has contacted the Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase another calf. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase another calf.

loans.name: Kaneeza

texts.en:
Kaneeza is 48-year-old married woman who has sold milk for many years. She has four milk cows. She sells to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. 

She has improved her business to meet day-to-day expenses. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  

This is her fourth year with the Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through its support. Now she has requested a loan of Rs 45,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to increase milk production, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more milk cow.

loans.name: Ulfat

texts.en:
Ulfat is a 35-year-old married woman who has run a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has buffaloes, which she uses for milk production, selling to the people of her locality. Ulfat has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Ulfat is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a 40-year-old married lady and has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. 

To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of Rs 40,000, which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she will be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour for her general store.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 45-year-old married woman. She runs a small beauty parlor in a corner of her house. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hairstyling and facials. Over the time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family's income. 

Her customer base has grown over time, so she requires hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. Thus, she has applied for a loan of Rs. 40,000 through the Kashf Foundation. She is in her seventh loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and is confident that her business will move in a positive direction as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Manzooran is a 48-year-old, energetic married woman. She has a business manufacturing stoves in various sizes. She has become famous for providing good-quality cement stoves in her community. In this way she is able to manage the needs of her family members, as her husband is a laborer whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of his family members alone.  

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation; currently she is in her fifth loan cycle and has applied for a loan of Rs. 50,000. She intends to use this loan to purchase good-quality cement and some tools used in making stoves. It will help her to increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality cement and some tools.

loans.name: Hajran

texts.en:
Hajran is a 54-year-old married woman. She is the mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She has been successfully running a small general store with her son (also shown in the photo). She has two years of experience in this field. Her son also assists her by purchasing goods from the market, as he has developed many contacts over the years. 

Hajran wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of 40,000 Pakistani rupees to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand for these products at her store. She is expecting to boost her earnings and she dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Luz, con 38 años de edad, es casada y madre de 2 hijas, por quienes ha luchado incansablemente para sacarlas adelante. Desde hace varios años posee una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su casa, allí trabaja todos los días de 6:00 am a 10:00 pm; adicionalmente posee una pequeña papelería con la que complementa los ingresos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar. Su principal desafío es enfrentarse a la competencia que llegó en los últimos años al sector, sin embargo ella se ha dado a conocer por su bien servicio y la calidad de los productos que ofrece. 
Su perseverancia y dedicación le han permitido salir adelante a pesar de los diversos obstáculos y siempre va en busca de nuevas alternativas que le ayuden a progresar. Por esta razón se anima a solicitar el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará surtido al por mayor para la tienda y la papelería (lácteos, carnes frías, galletería, huevos, azúcar, granos, cuadernos, lapiceros, marcadores, cartulinas, entre otros), logrando así, abastecer el inventario de ambos negocios para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta con la temporada decembrina, dando como resultado un incremento en las ventas y en los ingresos que recibe.
Luz, con empeño y esfuerzo, desea hacer crecer su negocio hasta cumplir el sueño de convertirlo en un autoservicio, en el que todos los clientes encuentren los productos que requieran, además esto le permitirá garantizar una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a sus hijas una mejor educación y disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Luz, 38, is married and the mother of 2 daughters, for whom she has fought tirelessly to get them ahead. She has had a small grocery store located in her house for several years. There, she works every day from 6:00 AM to 10:00 PM. Also, she has a small paper store with which she complements her income to support her husband with the economic burden of the home. Her main challenge is to confront the competition that arrived to the region in recent years. Without doubt she has become known for her good service and the quality of products that she offers.

Her perseverance and dedication have allowed her to get ahead in spite of the diverse obstacles. She is always in search of new alternatives that will help her progress. For this reason, she is motivated to apply for the help of the loan with which she will buy stock in bulk for the food store and the paper store (dairy products, cold cuts, cookies and crackers, eggs, sugar, grains, notebooks, pencils, markers, construction paper, among others). In this way, she will achieve stocking the inventory of both businesses to satisfy the demand that grows with the December season, giving as a result an increase in sales and income that she receives.

Luz, with commitment and effort, wishes to make her business grow until she achieves the dream of turning it into a self-service convenience store, where all of the customers find the products that they need. Additionally, this will allow her to guarantee favorable economic stability to give her daughters a better education and enjoy better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bulk stock for her grocery and paper store.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 76 years old and widowed with nine children.

Nelly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, and school supplies.

Nelly has borrowed and repaid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Nelly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items for her store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of seven children, Virginia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Virginia is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell to customers.

Virginia has been sustaining her business activities through her past twenty-two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Dodgie

texts.en:
This is Ma. Dodgie, 53, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eliseo, a pensioner, and they have children who are both working already. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Dodgie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a Php15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Ma. Dodgie hopes to have more customers and dreams that her family will always be in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 30-years old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She requested a loan for her husband’s fruits selling business. Her husband has worked in the wholesale fruits selling business for many years. He daily goes to the field which is situated in different villages; carries the fruits and sells them in the fruit market to the retailers. He knows the fruit market rates, retailers and how to tackle the customers. For getting more profit he wants to grow his business but due to lack of fund he is unable to buy more fruits. 

Therefore, Saima requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner so that her husband can establish his fruits business by purchasing fruits in bulk. She hopes that this loan will prove productive for business and she will save reasonable amount soon. Saima is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy fruits from the field to sell to retailers.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business selling mobile phones and phone accessories. Her business is located in a busy area, and her customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as the changes in tastes and preferences of her customers. 

Caroline will use this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add stock of mobile phones and phone accessories. She hopes, in the future, she will economically sustain her business. This is her first loan with SMEP--Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: add stock of mobile phones and phone accessories

loans.name: Sreyphoen

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in the Kandal Steong district of Kandal province, Sreyphoen is aged 31 years and married. She has three children, two of whom are in school. To make a living, she has been pumping the sand in the village. Having been in this business for six years, together she and her husband can earn about USD 17 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the first microloan for Sreyphoen with VisionFund. With this loan, she is going to buy a decent motorbike for her family to commute. She hopes to have a proper motorbike for using in her family.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her family to commute

loans.name: Ma. Rebecca

texts.en:
Ma. Rebecca is 56 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ma. Rebecca has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Rebecca requested a loan through NWTF in the amount of PHP 10000 to buy additional goods--like flour, sugar, salt, etc.--for her business.

Ma. Rebecca has been in this business for 20 years. Ma. Rebecca would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for her business.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 76 years old and widowed with 11 children.

Matilde works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 9,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Matilde has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 21 years and also earns an income from selling personal products.

Matilde aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anadela

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Anadela works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Anadela is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Anadela has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
Lena is from Gyumri town in Armenia. She lives there with her parents and works at a local company as a lawyer. 

Lena studies at the Public Administration Academy of the Republic of Armenia and is currently in her second course of study. She has already taken a loan from SEF and has a good credit history behind her. 

Realizing that she isn't able to cover her tuition for second year, she has decided to apply for this new loan. With this loan, Lena will be able to cover her university tuition and continue her education at the academy.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for the second year of university

loans.name: Diana Marcela

texts.es:
Diana es una joven de 17 años, nacida bajo el techo de una familia amorosa y llena de muchos valores, desde pequeña siempre soño con ser enfermera, pues ella es una chica que le a la que le interesa, el bienestar de los demás, aprovecharía eso para cuidarlos, cuidar a los pacientes y a si misma, lograr hacer de la vida un momento agradable y que por un instante se olvidan de la enfermedad y tuvieran un segundo de tranquilidad y alivio.
