loans.name: Mehronby

texts.en:
Mehronby is 54 years old. She is a glorious woman. Mehronby is married and has four children. Her children are adults. Her husband works in a state organization. Mehronby does not have higher education. She began her own business, growing agricultural products, five years ago. 

Mehronby grows vegetables, such as potatoes, tomatoes, cucumber, onion and etc. She has her own land. Mehronby works hard from early morning every day because she wants to get a good harvest and sell it to local people. 

She is going to sow, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers, and fuel.

loans.name: Nasibakhon

texts.ru: Насибахон родом из района Кубадиён. Ей 43 года. Она замужем и у нее четверо детей. Старший сын в России на заработках, а остальные дети еще маленькие и учатся в школе. Насибахон на протяжении двух лет занимается куплей и продажей миндаля. Она вместе с мужем ходит по селам и деревням, оптом покупает миндаль у дехкан и затем привозит домой. Вся семья помогает ей в деле. Они сортируют миндаль по сортам и затем с наценкой продают на рынках района. Это их семейный бизнес. В данный момент Насибахон просит кредит, чтобы закупить партию миндаля для перепродажи. Она ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Nasibakhon is from Kubad. She is 43. She is married and has four children. Her eldest son is working in Russia, and the other children are still young and in school. Nasibakhon has been buying and selling almonds for two years. She, along with her husband, goes to villages and buys almonds wholesale from farmers and then brings them home. The whole family then helps her. They sort the almonds into grades and then sell them for a profit at the market. This is their family business. Currently Nasibakhon is requesting a loan to buy almonds for resale. She is waiting for support.

loans.use: buy almonds for resale

loans.name: Generosite B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kamate est une brave commerçante, trésorière et membre d’une plate forme d’affaires «Générosité B», senior entrepreneur,dynamique, âgée de 34 ans, responsable et mère de 3 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse d’habits de meilleure qualité (pagnes super wax). Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché animé de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de sa mère biologique et qui fut aussi son initiatrice. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 45 pièces de pagnes. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite devenir grossiste, acheter une parcelle et la construire, scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment critique, poste conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Kamate, age 34, is a brave merchant and a member and the treasurer of Générosité B Group. She's energetic and an experienced senior entrepreneur. She's the mother and caretaker of three children, who all go to school.

Kamate sells superior clothing (Super Wax "pagnes", a kind of colorful African cloth). She displays her products at the busy market in her town. She started her business with support from her biological mother, who also trained her.

Later on, she got a loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Hekima. She's been running her business for 10 years. This new loan will be used to buy 45 pieces of pagnes. In the future, she wishes to become a wholesaler, buy a land lot to build a house, and feed her children and send them to school.

In the end, she strongly thanks Hekima for its contribution to making women entrepreneurs who are excluded from traditional banks self-supporting, especially at this critical post-war time in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy 45 pieces of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Mariam Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Kavanga est une commerçante d’une expérience de 4 ans, âgée de 40 ans et mère de 8 enfants, tous étudient. La cliente est présidente et membre d’une Association d’Affaires « Mariam ». Elle est vendeuse de divers habits. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché mouvementé de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son activité. Elle va acheter 1 ballon de friperie et autres habits de prestige.  Son conjoint,lui aussi, est commerçant. Elle démarra ses affaires avec le fonds  reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables en leur accordant de crédit pendant, ce moment de poste conflit dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en: The borrower, Kavanga, is a retailer with a four-year experience in her field.  She is 40 years old and the mother of eight children who all go to school.  She is a member and the leader of a business association called "Mariamu".  She sells various types of clothes, displaying her goods at her town's busy market.  She is taking a loan from Hekima in order to increase her activity.  She will buy one bale of used clothing as well as other pricier clothes.  Kavanga's husband also works in retail. Kavanga started her own business with some money received from her husband.  In the future, she would like to increase her capital, feed her children, buy them clothes and pay for their education.  She thanks Hekima for the support it provides to women with no access to the traditional banking system, and for granting them loans during this post-conflict period in the Eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy one bale of used clothing and other pricier clothes.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Nazoratkhon

texts.ru: Назоратхон родом из города Исфара. Она 43-летняя замужняя женщина с тремя детьми. Сыну 21 год, а дочерям по 18 и 10 лет. Назоратхон имеет торговый бизнес. Ее магазин расположен рядом с центральной больницей. Она продает там женские теплые халаты, ночные одежды, а также полотенце и т.д. Назоратхон занимается данным бизнесом на протяжении 18 лет. Ее муж мастер строитель. Старший сын уехал на заработки в Россию, а дочери учатся. Назоратхон  трудолюбивая, усердная женщина. Она работает в своем магазине с утра до вечера, чтобы обеспечивать семью. Сейчас она нуждается в кредите для развития своего бизнеса. Она собирается закупить ассортимент товара и для этого просит кредит. Она ждет и надеется на финансовую помощь.
texts.en: Nazoratkhon is from the city of Isfara.  She is a 43-year-old married woman with three children.  Her son is 21 years old, and daughters are 18 and 10 years old.  Nazoratkhon has a retail outlet.  Her store is located near the central hospital.  She sells women's warm robes, sleepwear and also towels and etc. there.  Nazoratkhon has been involved in this business for 18 years.  Her husband is a construction worker.  The oldest son left to work in Russia, and the daughters are studying.  Nazoratkhon is a hardworking and diligent woman.  She works at her store from morning to night in order to provide for his family.  Now she needs a loan to develop her business.  She is planning to purchase a selection of merchandise and is requesting a loan for this.  She is awaiting and hoping for financial help.

loans.use: to purchase women's warm robes, sleepwear and towels

loans.name: Green Tomalin Group

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman and has been blessed with a son who is in school. She is currently in her early 30s. Since 2003, Rose has been managing a poultry business (broiler chickens). She starts her business early at 6:00 am until 07:00 pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her ninth loan request, which she will use to buy chicks for her business. Rose expects to buy more chicks in the coming months so as to make her business grow and manage her expenses. She used her previous loans to maintain her number of chicks and bought the chicks food. Rose is a good customer of Tujijenge who has paid all of her previous loans successfully. With her business profit, she built a house to rent. Rose covered part of her family's food expenses and school fees. She dreams of improving her rental house more.
She will share this loan with her loan group "Green Tomalin" which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her business.

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is 41 years old. She is married with four children. All of her children attend school. 

She sells bananas and has spent seven years in the business. She has requested a loan to buy more bananas for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en: Immaculee is 27 years old and married to a businessman. She sells foodstuffs, which she has been doing for two years. Immaculee has recently shifted from selling shoes to sell foodstufs. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more potatoes, sugar, and rice for sale. With the profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, sugar, and rice for sale

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.ru:
Нафиса умелая швея. Она шьёт прекрасные национальные платья для женщин. Нафиса швея с детство. У неё талант к этому мастерству. В юношеском возрасте ходила на ученики к швейному мастеру. Там же она научилась всем тонкостям своего дела. Когда Нафиса создала семью и родила двоих детей нужда в дополнительных средствах увеличилось и она решила самостоятельно открыть свое дело. В этом деле её поддержал муж. Ведь и ему тоже не безразличен завтрашний день своей семьи. 
Поначалу Нафиса пользовалась старой швейной машинкой. Но потом решила приобрести  новую собственную швейную машинку и она приобрела швейную машинку «Ямата». В связи с высокой конкурентности  и увеличение потребности семьи в дополнительных средствах Нафиса хочет купить вышивальную машинку. Этим она и её «маленький бизнес» смогут «выжить» и продолжат обслужить большее количество клиентов зарабатывая нужную сумму на образование детей и благополучие своей семьи.
 Она очень надеется, что приобретённый кредит поможет ей не остаться на половине пути и перешагнуть этот трудный момент. Заранее благодарит  МДО «Арванд» за содействие и поддержку.
texts.en:
Nafisa is a skilled seamstress. She sews fantastic national dresses for women. Nafisa has sewn since childhood. She has a talent for this. At a young age, she was an apprentice to a seamstress. There she learnt all details of this activity. 

When Nafisa started a family and gave birth to two children, the need for additional funds increased and she decided to open her own business. Her husband supported her in this business. After all, he is not indifferent to his family's future. In the beginning, Nafisa used an old sewing machine. Then she decided to purchase a new sewing machine and she purchased one of the brand "Yamata". 

Due to high competition and the family's increasing need for additional money, Nafisa would like to purchase an embroidery machine. With this, she and her small business will be able to "survive", and continue to service more customers, earning the necessary amount for the children's education and the family's well-being. 

Nafisa very much hopes that the credit received will help her to move beyond this difficult time. She thanks "MDO Arvand" in advance for the assistance and support.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Nazaire

texts.fr: Nazaire est un homme de 48 ans, père de famille. Il est commerçant et a ouvert une petite alimentation qu'il gère lui même depuis 9 ans. C'est grâce à elle qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa famille. grâce à son accueil chaleureux et ses relations de bon voisinage, il a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle qui s'accroit au fil du temps, et là, il ne parvient plus à la satisfaire totale d'où la nécessité de ce crédit dans son activité en ce moment parce qu'il lui permettra d'augmenter le stock des produits de première nécessité. Ceci augmentera ses ventes et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Bénéfice qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Nazaire is a 48-year-old family man. He is a shopkeeper who opened a small grocery store, which he has run single-handedly for the past nine years. It is thanks to his hard work that he has been able to meet his family's needs. Thanks to his warm personality and his neighbourly attitude, he has amassed a loyal customer base, which he built up over time. Right now, he is no longer able to totally satisfy this customer base, which is where the need for this loan arises. This loan will allow him to increase his stock of high-necessity products and to refurbish his premises. This will increase his sales and thereby his profit margins. These profits will be partially reinvested into his business in order to expand it and the rest will allow him to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to increase his stock of high-necessity products

loans.name: Prel

texts.en:
Prel wants to buy a dairy cow. For the past six years he has been running his own livestock activity. The cows seen far in the background of this photo are his own cows grazing on his land. Kindly note that Prel did not want to have a close-up photograph of himself. 

He sells raw milk to the market of a nearby town. In addition to the livestock he creates handcrafted wooden items that he then sells at the market. “I love making craft. It requires extreme patience and talent. Althought I do not generate a good income from it, I love it,” is what Prel said to the loan officer during his interview. 

Prel is married and has an 18-year-old child who goes to public school.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en: Mamuka is a 32-year-old experienced farmer from the village of Tskhratskaro. He lives with his parents, wife and two children. His parents both get monthly assistance from the local government.  Mamuka's wife works as a cleaner and generates 200 GEL monthly.  Mamuka has been involved in agricultural activities for 16 years already. He takes care of two cattle, 1 pig and a vineyard, that has 0.5 hectare developed.  Mamuka can't get ahead of all the financial difficulties with the help of this mentioned income. He has a great desire to improve his family's living conditions and requested a loan. His loan was approved with the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the start up program that enables the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. He needs 4,000 GEL to purchase stock of different home products to open a general store near his house. This loan will be a huge support for this hard-working man and his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase stock of different home products and open a general store

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is from Armavir, where she lives together with her 3-year-old son. For about a year, Anna has been running a small store where she trades with food products. 

Due to a kind attitude toward people, Alla was able to gain customers in Armavir town. Now, as the business is new, Alla needs to fill the store with new products. 

So, she has applied for this loan to purchase products needed for the store. 

Alla had already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately, wasn't able to return it back. However, thanks to the hard work during the recent times, Alla was able to open a new store, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

The loan is very important for Alla to have a successful business and gather more income for her son.

loans.use: to pay for food products needed to sell in the store

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is from Malishka village. He lives there with his wife and 14-year-old son. 

Samvel is a farmer with 30 years of experience. He runs a farm which includes livestock: chickens, turkeys, cows and calves. Near the village where they live, Samvel also owns arable land where he grows nuts, apples and pear trees. Samvel sells the gathered harvest in a nearby open market and earns income which is vital for his family's living. As there are no job opportunities in the village, locals here are mainly involved in agriculture. So for Samvel, this is also the main source of income and he works hard to gather a good harvest.

Now for applying for this loan, Samvel is asking for financial support to be able to renovate his greenhouse and enlarge the cultivation process.  Samvel has already taken out a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of hard financial conditions wasn't able to pay it back on time. However, thanks to the hard work during recent times, he was able to run his farming in a way that it ensures stable financial income during the month. So, Samvel has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. The loan will greatly help Samvel and his family to overcome financial difficulties and continue expanding their farm.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the greenhouse

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 27 years old. She is married with three children. She has been selling both soft drinks and beer for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more food for the family and make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more food for the family and make more savings

loans.name: Abahiriwe Cb Group

texts.en:
Abahiriwe means “The Blessed” in English.

Francine, 45, is married and for the past six years has sold goats. She is also this group’s leader. She states, “All group members have different business types, but they have come together as a way of organizing themselves for the better. All of the group members have same vision of transforming their lives.”

As leader, Francine is applying for a 2,280,000 RWF through Urwego on behalf of the group. The loan will be apportioned out to the group members. With her portion Francine intends to buy more goats to sell. The profits from her business will be used to provide food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more goats to sell.

loans.name: Mirvete

texts.en:
A hardworking and friendly thirty-six-year-old, Mirvete is a very polite woman who tries to work hard. She has been operating a business as a seamstress for nearly 10 years, making traditional clothes and selling them to customers who custom order them, and also sometimes in the market to local customers.

Mirvete has a modest workshop in her home where she tends to all of her customers in a friendly and polite manner. Customers leave satisfied with the good work that she does. She likes her business as it allows her to demonstrate her creativity in each clothing item. She also likes that the income she makes from her work allows her to support her family. This is extremely helpful because her husband earns a small amount of money from his employment as a guard for a construction company. Together she and her husband have three children between the ages of two and eight, and they live together in an old house they own in a minority community in the southern part of Kosovo. 

Mirvete has been sustaining her business through her own efforts all of these years, but now she is applying for a loan in the amount of 500 Euros. She will use this money to buy materials for her business such as fabric, elastic, buttons and more. She hopes to earn a higher income and to expand her business in the future. She is happy for the financial support from Kiva lenders because it helps her to secure a stable future for her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for her business such as fabric, elastic, buttons and more

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Alejandro con su crédito anterior en la compra de insumos con los cuales elaboró desinfectantes; con au crédito anterior  pudo redireccionar su negocio con desinfectantes y conseguir nuevos clientes al tener mayor variedad de productos. Ahora es mas reconocido, lo que ha permitido que sus ingresos se incrmenten y que su calidad de vida mejore.Alejandro encia el siguiente mensjae a los finaciadores de Kiva: " Agradezco a las personas de Kiva por haberme brindado la oportunidad de reactivar mi negocio". En la actualidad él, está aplicando a un nuevo finacimeinto, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina, articulos de miscelanea en compañia de su suegra que tiene un punto comercial donde tambien exhibe los productos de uso doméstico que Alejandro vende. Inversión que muy seguramente aumentará su potencialidad de exito, en el mercado al cual le apunta.
texts.en: Thanks to your support, Alejandro was able to purchase supplies to make disinfectants with his previous loan. He was able to redirect his disinfectant business and take on new clients with a wider variety of products. Now he is better known, which has helped him increase his income and improve his quality of life. Alejandro sends the following message to Kiva lenders: "I thank the people of Kiva for having provided me the opportunity to rejuvenate my business." Currently Alejandro is requesting a new loan, through which he plans to purchase a display case and miscellaneous items in company with his mother-in-law, who has a sales post where she can exhibit the household products Alejandro sells. This investment will almost certainly improve his chances for success.

loans.use: to purchase a display case and miscellaneous articles.

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: Садбарг 38-летняя швея из района Варзоб. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Пять лет тому назад Садбарг открыла свое швейное дело. Она знает профессию швеи еще с юного возраста. Ее мать была швеей и научила дочь своему ремеслу. Садбарг очень нравится шить и придумывать разные фасоны для платьев. К каждому своему заказу она относится серьезно и получает удовольствие от результата работы. Садбарг собирается расширить свое дело. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить модернизированную компьютерную швейную машинку. Благодаря этой машинке процесс ее работы будет быстрее и качественнее.
texts.en: Sadbarg is a 38-year-old seamstress from the Varzob district.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  Sadbarg opened her own sewing business five years old.  She has known the seamstress occupation since a young age.  Her mother was a seamstress and taught her daughter her trade.  Sadbarg likes to sew and come up with different dress designs very much.  She treats every one of her orders seriously and get satisfaction from the results of her work.  Sadbarg is planning to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a modern computerized sewing machine.  Thanks to this machine, her work process will be faster and with more quality.

loans.use: to purchase a modern computerized sewing machine

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen used the previous loan to buy a motor cycle for transport business. He is a 40-year-old married man with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children and buy a car. He has been in transport for the last five years and his main hardship is the high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of owning at least  five motorcycles and hiring employees to help expand his business.Stephen is requesting for a loan to buy a third motorcycle, which he will hire out to a rider who will be remitting 80% of the daily earnings.

loans.use: to buy a third motorcycle for transportation.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 29 years old, married, and has been blessed with children between one and five years old. He supports ten people. He runs a food place, a business he has operated for the past one year. His monthly income from the business is KES. 15,000.

Bernard is borrowing a loan of KES. 50,000 which he intends to use to expand his business by buying a weighing machine. He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to educate his children to improve the living standards of his family and to expand his business by creating employment opportunities. 	

This is his first loan and his hopes and dreams are to open more branches to provide food services to the people.

loans.use: To buy a weighing machine for his food business

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 44 years old and married. He and his wife have been blessed with three children and he supports six members of the family. He is a dairy farmer and has been in business for five years. Right now, his monthly income from the business is 8,000 KES.

He is borrowing a loan of 60,000 KES, which he intends to use to purchase a local feed mixer for his dairy farming. He will use the anticipated profit to construct a biogas plant. 

This is his second loan and he successfully repaid his previous loan. He hopes to become an Ayrshire breeder.

loans.use: To purchase dairy feed equipment.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 57-year-old married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 16 to 24 years. He describes himself to be determined.

He operates a welding store where he makes metallic doors, chairs, tables, etc. He has been involved in this business for 13 years. His primary customers are local customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds.

He will use the 10,000 KES  loan to buy metal bars and metal sheets for making chairs, tables, etc. He hopes that in the future he will be able to create employment for the youth. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to increase his stock of metal.

loans.use: to buy metal bars and metal sheets for making chairs and tables

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a 45-year-old married father of two from Thika; he has a business as a mixed crop farmer. Richard also runs a grocery store, a business that supplements his income. He has been in the farming business for the past 10 years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

With the loan he has applied from VisionFund Kenya, he will be able to purchase a bull and buy more groceries for his grocery store.  The additional income created will allow him to expand on the farm land and pay school fees for his children. 

In the future, Richard would like to offer his children a quality education and improve the living standards of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a bull and buy more groceries for his grocery store

loans.name: Cornelius

texts.en:
Cornelius is a 41-year-old married man. He has three children aged three to 10 years old. Cornelius describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business selling shoes and socks. He has been involved in this business for five years. 

His business is located in a conducive environment, and he sells primarily to small-scale customers. He describes his biggest business challenge as low returns. He will use the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a stock of shoes for resale. 

His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that he will be prosperous  in the future. This is his first loan with SMEP--Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. He will use the anticipated profits to buy farm inputs to start farming to earn extra income.

loans.use: buy a stock of shoes for resale

loans.name: St Jane  Francis Group

texts.en: Susan is a 49-year-old single mother of three children living in Kasese,Uganda. She is involved in a number of activities such as farming, brick laying and also earns a salary as a civil servant. She has been in the brick laying business for ten years. She started the business in order to raise money to pay school fees for her children. Prolonged rains and limited capital affect her business growth while her dreams are to set up a brick making factory and also expand her farming activities, Susan is requesting for a loan to buy land for farming. She a member of the above mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a retail shop and has been in business since 2009. A good father that he is he desires to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualifications and set up other income generating activities to secure their future. Inadequate capital and high license fees pose a challenge to his business growth while his dream is to own a wholesale shop. William intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Boston Elshadai Devt Group

texts.en: Aidah is a married business lady with four children and a member of Boston Elshadai Development group who currently runs a tailoring business and a small retail shop in one of the city’s low-scale suburbs. Aidah is a responsible, hardworking woman who runs several business activities to sustain her family's pressing needs - something she has done for over ten years. She is only challenged by limited capital which she hopes will soon be history after the partnership with Kiva through UGAFODE. She will use the loan to buy an electronic sewing machine that will make her work faster and easier. This will increase her output and profits in the long run since she will be able to sew many clothes in a short time.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with seven children, three of whom attend school, and the rest are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has been selling cows and goats at the market to the general public. The main challenge for her business has been unstable market prices. 

She joined Yehu in order to gain access to funds. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to purchase more cows and goats for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cows and goats for her business.

loans.name: Zulaykho

texts.ru: Зулайхо жизнерадостная женщина. Она родилась в 1956 года. Зулайхо имеет большой опыт в сфере купле продажи. Она более 10 лет занимается купле продажей сухофруктов. Она продает курагу и миндаль. Зулайхо продает свой товар в открытой части базара. Поэтому зимой очень холодно, а летом жарко. Она хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом увеличить доход. С полученного дохода она собирается получить точку продажи с внутри рынка. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки сухофруктов для расширения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zulaykho is a cheerful woman. She was born in 1956. Zulaykho has a lot of experience in the sphere of trade. For more than ten years, she has been buying and selling dried fruits. She sells dried apricots and almonds. Zulaykho sells her goods in the open part of the bazaar. Therefore in winter it is very cold, and in the summer it is hot. She wants to increase her working capital and in this way to increase her income.

With the earned income, she is going to get a point of sale within the market. She is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni to purchase dried fruits to expand her working capital.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Zura

texts.ru: Зура 61 год, вдова, одна воспитала сына. У Зуры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Зура занимается животноводством, стартовав 29 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зуры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 3 лошади, 2 бычка, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,20 ГА, на которой выращивает картофель, ячмень и пшеницу. Зура живет вместе с сыном, который помогает ей по хозяйству. Зура доит коров, а сын сдает молоко на ежедневной основе реализаторам за наличный расчет. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зура обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом- на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Зура планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на покупку квартиры для сына.
texts.en:
Zura is 61 years old, widowed, and raised her son on her own. Zura has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Zura raises livestock, having started 29 years ago with the purchase of cattle for 5,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Zura today has on her homestead: two dairy cows, three horses, and two steers, and also has a plot of land measuring 1.20 hectares, on which she grows potatoes, barley and wheat.

Zura lives with her son, who helps her around the farm. Zura milks the cows, and her son delivers milk on a daily basis to distributors for cash. Monthly income consists of 12,000 som (KGS). With the aim of further developing her farm, Zura turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to purchase steers for fattening with the subsequent sale at the market at a premium.

Zura plans to invest income from the loan in further propagating the quantity of domestic animals, and intends to save money to purchase an apartment for her son.

loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Lira

texts.ru: Лире 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей, все дети -школьники. У Лиры - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Лира занимается животноводством, стартовав 21 год назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Лиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 1 нетель, 1 теленок, 8 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 16,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Лира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Лира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en:
Lira is 42 years old, married, and with her husband is raising four children. All the children go to school. Lira has a high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Lira raises livestock, having started 21 years ago with a purchase of livestock for 2,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Lira today has on her farm: two dairy cows, one heifer, one calf, and eight sheep. Monthly income consists of 16,000 som (KGS).

With the aim of further developing her farm, Lira applied to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan - to purchase a horse for increasing her livestock count.

Lira plans to invest income from the loan in further propagation of the quantity of domestic animals, and plans to save money for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy a horse

loans.name: Fotimajon

texts.ru: Фотимачон добросовестная женщина. Она родилась в 1955 года. Она вдова и имеет 4 детей. Трое ее детей совершеннолетние, а один младший не совершеннолетний. После смерти мужа Фотимачон начала свой бизнес 10 лет назад национальных тюбетеек. Она покупает сырье с Республики Узбекистан. Фотимачон шьёт тюбетейки и продает на местном рынке. Она имеет своих регулярных клиентов на местном рынке. Благодаря высокому качеству товара, она смогла привлечь клиентов. Ее клиенты довольны качествами товара. Фотимачон хочет увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом развивать бизнес дальше. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки тканей, нитки и т.п. для увеличения оборотного капитала. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Fotimajon is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1955. She is a widow and has four children. Three of her children are grown, and one the youngest is a minor. After the death of her husband, Fotimajon began her own business ten years ago in national skullcaps.

She buys raw materials from the Republic of Uzbekistan. Fotimajon sews skullcaps and sells them at the local market. She has her own regular customers at the market. Thanks to the high quality of her goods, she was able to attract customers. Her customers are pleased with the quality of her goods.

Fotimajon wants to increase her working capital and in this way to develop her business further. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni to purchase fabrics, threads, etc. to expand her working capital.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads for increasing her working capital

loans.name: Javohir

texts.ru:
Чавохир трудолюбивая женщина. Она добросовестная женщина. Чавохир замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она уже более 11 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она опытная портниха. Чавохир шьет национальные женские платья, национальные матрасы и платки. Чавохир имеет своих регулярных клиентов. Она предоставляет свои услуги на высшем уровне и своевременно. Благодаря упорному труду и честности она имеет хорошую репутацию среди местного населения. Чавохир запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки тканей. 
Она повторный клиент ИМОНа и имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Она погасила другие займы вовремя. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Javohir is a hardworking and conscientious woman. Javohir is married and is raising four children. For 11 years already, she has been involved in her own business. She is an experienced dressmaker. Javohir sews national women's dresses, national mattresses and shawls. Javohir has her regular customers. She offers her serves at a high level and in a timely manner. Thanks to her hard work and honesty, she has a good reputation among the local population. Javohir is requesting a loan of 6,000 somoni to purchase fabrics.

She is a repeat customer of IMON and has a good credit history. She repaid her other loans on time.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис по жизни трудолюбивый человек. Ей 41 год. Она проживает в городе Турсунзаде с мужем и двумя детьми. Ее дети ходят в школу. Наргис в течение 6 лет занимается растениеводством. Она выращивает в основном овощи. Ей помогает муж и дети. Наргис имеет небольшой приусадебный участок земли и сейчас готовится к очередному посеву. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит. На сумму от кредита Наргис собирается купить семена картофеля, лука и минеральные удобрения. Она надеется к весне получить хороший урожай и за счет прибыли улучшить жизненные условия.
texts.en: Nargis is a hardworking person in life.  She is 41 years old.  She lives in the city of Tursun-zoda with her husband and two children.  Her children attend a school.  Nargis has been involved in agriculture for 6 years.  She primarily grows vegetables.  Her husband and children help her.  Nargis has a small plot of land by her house and is preparing for the next sowing now.  She is requesting a loan to achieve this goal.  Nargis plans to purchase potato and onion seeds and mineral fertilizers.  She hopes to get a good harvest by the spring and improve living conditions with the resulting profit.

loans.use: to purchase potato and onion seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Alcira

texts.es: La señora Alcira está separada de su esposo,  desde hace mucho tiempo vive en la zona de villa primero de mayo, tiene una hija dependiente de sus ingresos de 14 años,  ella como madre soltera saco adelante a toda su familia trabajando y esforzándose a diario, actualmente logro tener una tienda de abarrotes la cual está instalada en su propia casa y de a poco fue abasteciéndola con diferentes productos para surtir su tienda,  pero aún le falta por ello solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería para su tienda y surtirla más, de esta forma incrementara sus ventas  y lograra cubrir los gastos en los que incurre su familia  y mejorara su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Alcira is separated from her husband.  She has lived in the District of Villa Primero de Mayo for quite some time.  Alcira has a 14-year-old daughter who is financially dependent on her.  

Being a single mother, Alcira must work and strive each day so that her entire family can get ahead.  She currently has a grocery store in her home that she gradually stocked with different products.  Alcira still lacks a few items, so she is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise for her store so that there will be more inventory.  This will enable her to increase her sales so that she can cover her family's expenses and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Lucia Erlinda

texts.es: Lucia Erlinda, de 57 años de edad, soltera con cuatro hijos, posee una actividad económica de venta de mercaderia en general con mas de treinta años de administrar este negocio, tiempo en que ha logrado expandir mas en variedad de mercaderia, sus compras las realiza en el mercado oriental de Managua, sus ventas son al crédito y al contado de manera ambulante y en casa a clientes fijos y eventuales. Lucia esta muy agradecida con los inversionistas por la oportunidad que le han brindado en adquirir este financiamiento, ya que ha logrado tener un mejor nivel de vida y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: 57-year-old Lucia Erlinda, a single woman with four children, is economically active in general merchandise sales with more than thirty years of managing this business, in which time she has managed to further expand the variety of merchandise. Her purchases are made in the eastern market of Managua, her sales are credit and cash as a street vendor and at home with permanent and temporary customers. Lucia is very grateful to the investors for the opportunity that they have given her to acquire this funding, as she has achieved a better standard of living and can go on with her family.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza De Lacaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPERANZA DE LACAYA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eusebia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, macramé en mantillas, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, compra y venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eusebia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de pesca y venta; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años cuando ya que era un negocio familia y posterior a su tener su pareja decide independizarse.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de redes) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Esperanza de Lacaya group is about to enter their first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi focal point.  The group is made up of 8 members, and is led by a board of directors of which Eusebia is the President.  The members are involved in a variety of businesses which include: blanket weaving, food sales, corner stores, purchase and sale of cattle.  

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small businesses that Eusebia is a member of.  She states that this is the first time they have joined Pro Mujer, they were invited by a sponsor from the institution who visited her home.  Currently, Eusebia has a business catching and selling fish.  She learned this trade many years ago because it was a family business, and after meeting her husband, she decided to branch out on her own.  

The loan will help her to purchase nets which she will buy from the wholesalers in the city of La Paz, and she will then install them in her workspace.  This line of work allows her to generate an income to support her family as she lives in a common-law marriage and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she likes the training offered by the institute.

loans.use: purchase nets.

loans.name: Normurot

texts.ru: Нормурот житель района Шахритус. Он молодой дехканин. Ему 25 лет. Нормурот женат, детей еще не имеет. Он живет с женой у родителей. Их в семье семеро человек. Все они заняты в сельском хозяйстве. У них имеется приусадебный участок орошаемой земли, на которой выращивают зерновые и огородные культуры. Нормурот занимается растениеводством более 8 лет. Он унаследовал это ремесло у отца, который тоже был дехканином. Нормурот сейчас проводит посев. Он запрашивает кредит для купли семян картофеля, минеральных удобрений и топлива. Этот кредит ему очень важен для того чтобы получить урожай весной.
texts.en:
Normurot is a resident of the Shahrituz region of Tajikistan. He is a young dekhan farmer who is 25 and married without children. He lives with his wife at his parent's house. There are 7 people in the family, and they all work in agriculture. They have an irrigated plot of land adjoining their farmhouse where they grow grain and garden vegetables. Normurot has been growing crops for more than 8 years. His father, also a dekhan farmer, taught him the ropes.

Currently, Normurot is preparing to sow his fields, and, to that end, is requesting a loan to buy potato seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel. This loan is crucial for him and his spring harvest.

loans.use: buy potato seeds, mineral fertilizers and fuel

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 46 años de edad y hace algunos años se quedo a cargo de su hogar ya que su esposo falleció. Habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 16  y 7 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida mediante el comercio de mariscos: camarones, conchas y pescado.  Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y es lo que le ha permito dar a sus hijos lo necesario. Desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales por lo que ha solicitado este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en el enladrillado del piso el cual en la actualidad es de tierra. Con el crédito comprará cemento, ladrillo de piso, arena y pagará la mano obra la colocación del mismo. Expresa tener la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 46, became the head of household a few years ago when her husband passed away.  She lives in her own house with her two children, ages 16 and 7, and earns a living selling seafood and fish.  Her business is her main source of income and allows her to give her children everything they need.

In an effort to improve her children's living conditions, Mercedes is requesting a loan through FUSAI to put down floor covering on the current dirt floor.  The loan will be used to buy cement, floor tile and sand, and to hire workers for the job.  She says she will be able to pay back the loan.

loans.use: To buy cement, floor tiles, sand and to hire workers to repair her floor.

loans.name: Dinora Esperanza

texts.es: Dinora de 39 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos (2 años, 4 años, 7 años y 9 años de edad). Habita junto  a su grupo familiar en casa propia.  Dinora es una mujer muy creativa y emprendedora quien al ver las necesidades de las personas de su comunidad tuvo la idea de poner un molino de nixtamal para facilitar a las mujeres la molida de los diferentes granos como maíz, frijoles, arroz, etc. Tiene 5 años de tener el negocio y gracias a su buen servicio muchas personas la prefieren. Con mucho esfuerzo han logrado construir su casa la cual aún le hace falta el techo, razón por la cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina galvanizada, polines y pago de mano de obra  y así finalizar su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Dinora, 39, is married and has four children (age 2, 4, 7 and 9).  She lives with her family in her own home.  Dinora is a very creative entrepreneur who wanted to supply the local demand for a mill so women could mill different grains such as corn, beans, rice, etc.

She has been in business for five years and thanks to her good service many customers prefer to buy from her.  Through much effort she has been able to build a house but it still has no roof.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheeting and beams and to hrie workers so she can finish the house as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting and beams and to hire workers to put a roof over her house.

loans.name: Marisela Abigail

texts.es: Marisela de 21 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a su pequeña hija de 2 años de edad, sus padres y un hermano.  Marisela posee una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia la cual le ha permito dar lo necesario a su hija y colaborar con la economía de su hogar. Desea reparar el piso de la vivienda ya que con el tiempo se ha deteriorado, por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo de piso, arena, cemento y grava para dar inicio al cambio del piso y así dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a su familia.
texts.en: Marisela, 21, is a single mother and lives in her own house with her little daughter, who is two years old, her parents and a brother.  Marisela has a small store at home which allows her to earn enough to give her daughter everything she needs and to contribute to the household economy.  She wants to fix the floor in her house since it has deteriorated over time.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy floor tile, sand, cement and gravel to begin the job and give her family better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy floor tile, sand, cement and gravel to improve the floor of her house.

loans.name: Leyla Guadalupe

texts.es: Leyla  de 29 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio de forma ambulante desde hace mucho tiempo. Vende variedad de zapatos y sandalias las cuales son muy demandadas por sus clientes. Desea construir el corredor a su vivienda ya que cuando llueve el agua se filtra y daña sus pocas pertenencias, además, desea encementar el piso de la vivienda que en la actualidad es de tierra. Solicita este crédito  a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios para la construcción del corredor y el pavimento del piso. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, pilares, cemento, arena, y grava.
texts.en:
Leyla, 29, lives in her own home with her husband and little boy who is four years old.  She has worked for a long time as a street vendor selling different shoes and sandals which are in much demand by her customers.  She wants to build a hallway in her home since the rain that filters in damages her few belongings.  She also wants to put down a cement floor since the current one is a dirt floor.

She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy the materials necessary to build the hallway and to pave the floor.  The money will be used to buy metal sheeting, beams, cement, sand and gravel.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, beams, cement, sand and gravel to build a hallway and put down a cement floor.

loans.name: Jose Evaristo

texts.es: José tiene 57 años de edad y  reside junto a su esposa y su hijo d 13 años de edad. Él trabaja haciendo viajes a diferentes zonas del municipio, con mucho esfuerzo se hizo de un pick up el cual es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Desea mejorar las condiciones habitacionales de su familia por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación de las columnas de madera del corredor de su casa ya que se encuentran dañadas por los insectos y las lluvias. Además, desea repara el baño  sanitario de su casa ya que se ha dañado. Con el crédito comprará columnas de cemento y taza  de baño lavable.
texts.en:
José, 57, lives with his wife and 13-year-old son.  He works traveling to different areas of the municipality.  Through much effort he was able to obtain a pick-up truck which is his main work tool.  He wants to improve his family's normal living conditions and has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to replace the wood beams of the hallway at home which are damaged due to insects and rain.  He also wants to repair the bathroom which is damaged.

He will use the loan to buy cement beams and a flushing toilet.

loans.use: To buy cement pillars and a flushing toilet.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, se le presenta la necesidad de invertir más en la crianza de ganado y el cultivo, invertirá en la compra de semilla, abono y pago de mano de obra para el cultivo de granos básicos.
Con el préstamo anterior fortaleció su negocio ya que le facilito la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios, incremento sus ingresos, ha cancelado las cuotas de su crédito y mejor las condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Reina needs to invest again in her livestock and crop farming.  She needs to buy seeds and fertilizer and hire workers to cultivate basic grains.

Her previous loan allowed her to buy the farm supplies she needed.  She has paid back the loan and improved her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and to hire workers.

loans.name: Julia Elena

texts.es:
Julia, es soltera, no tiene hijos, hace mucho tiempo por iniciativa propia instalo una tienda en su residencia como una fuente de ingreso para cubrir sus gastos personales, atiende a sus clientes de 6:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m., por el momento no le representa ningún riesgo atenderlo.
Invertirá en la compra de bebidas, productos de la canasta básica, golosinas, etc., le servirá para dar mejores opciones de compra a sus clientes, espera atraer nuevos clientes, mejorar sus ventas y tener mayores ganancias.
Anhela a mejorar su situación económica para así ampliar el local de su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is single and has no children.  Some time ago, on her own initiative, she set up a store in her home which is a source of income for her personal expenses.  She attends to customers from 6:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m., and for the time being she is not running into problems.

She will buy beverages, staple goods, sweets, etc. so her customers will have a wider variety of products.  She hopes to attract new customers, improve sales and earn more profit.

Her goal is to improve her economic situation to expand her shop.

loans.use: To buy beverages, staple goods, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Narda

texts.es: Narda de 36 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 16 y 17 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace mucho tiempo. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que hace todo lo que este a su alcance para  darles mejores condiciones de vida. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del piso ya que actualmente se encuentra agrietado. Con el crédito comprará: cemento, arena y grava.
texts.en: Thirty-six-year-old Narda is a single mother and she lives in her own home with her two children, who are 16 and 17 years old.  She has been selling fruits and vegetables for a long time.  The most important thing to her is her family and that is why she does everything in her power to give them the best living conditions.  She is asking FUSAI for this loan to invest in repairing her floor, as it is currently cracked.  With the loan she will buy cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to repair the floor in her home

loans.name: Rosa Ybania

texts.es: Rosa de 25 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos (9 años, 6 años, 4 años y 3 años de edad) y habita junto a ellos en casa propia. Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa, lácteos y plátanos. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante desde hace 6 años. Con mucho esfuerzo  ha construido su vivienda la cual todavía le hace falta el techo del corredor, el piso y la instalación de la energía eléctrica. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, arena, cemento, grava y para instalar la luz eléctrica.
texts.en: Twenty-five-year-old Rosa is the mother of four children (a 9-year-old, a 6-year-old, a 4-year-old, and a 3-year-old) and she lives with them in her own home.  Rosa sells clothing, dairy products, and bananas for a living.  She has been doing her sales on foot for six years now.  She has built her home through a lot of effort and it still needs a roof in the hallway, a floor, and electricity to be installed.  She is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy sheet metal, sand, cement, and gravel, and to install electricity.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, sand, cement, and gravel to build a roof for the hallway and to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells charcoal from home. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She operates her business on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major challenge is seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children to university level. She would also like to diversify her business to food-vending. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La socia Marleni pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco- Perú. 
La socia continúa con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz, azúcar entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Marleni belongs to the "Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She continues to work in her grocery store selling different types of products such as rice,sugar, milk, etc.  She has been in business for quite some time and it has given her both economic and personal satisfaction.  Marleni wants to continue working to support her family.

She is seeking this loan to purchase merchandise such as rice, sugar and other items. Marleni is very grateful for KIVA for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and helping her to maintain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de aretes, collares, pulseras (bisutería) entre otros, la socia vende su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares, entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de eta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales como alambres, hilos, piedras entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower continues to engage in her costume jewelry business. She makes necklaces, earrings, and bracelets and sells them to different friends and family members.  She has been in business for quite some time and it is going well for her thanks to the hard work she dedicates every day.  The borrower is a responsible, enterprising person who supports her family through her work.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials, such as wire, thread, beads, etc.  The borrower is grateful for the loan that has been provided and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy materials such as wire, thread, beads, etc.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha es una mujer luchadora de 34 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos, su negocio es la artesanía en resina, elaboración de imágenes de todo tipo desde hace 10 años. Tiene a dos personas que le ayudan a elaborar las imágenes. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de materiales como es resina, talco simple, zener, pintura, cobalto.
texts.en: Martha is a hard-working woman who is 34-years old, married and has two children.  Her business is making resin handicrafts.  She has been making all types of pictures for the last ten years.  She has two people who help her make the pictures.  Martha is requesting the loan in order to purchase materials, such as resin, talc, zener, paint and cobalt.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as resin, talc, zener, paint and cobalt.

loans.name: Martha Ligia

texts.es: Martha mujer de 32 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es una pulpería ubicada en su domicilio desde hace 9 años, lleva de ser cliente de la institución 9 ciclos. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, gaseosa, cerveza, jugo de lata, jabón, ace, cloro, cigarros, papel higiénico, Golosinas, marucha, etc.
texts.en: Martha, age 32, is in a relationship and has two children. She has had a general store in her home for nine years and has been a client of the institution for nine cycles. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, pop, beer, canned juice, soap, Ace detergent, bleach, cigars, toilet paper, candy, steak, etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, pop, beer, canned juice, soap, Ace detergent, bleach, cigarres, toilet paper, candy, steak, etc.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana es una persona de negocio emprendedora y luchadora de 35 años, acompañada, con cuatro hijos, su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 6 años.Ella  misma atiende el negocio. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabones, gaseosa, cigarros, pan bimbo, tang, sopa maggi, jugos, papel higiénico, medicamentos, productos lácteos, productos descartables.
texts.en: Ana is a hard-working fighter of 35 years of age. She has a partner and four children and has run a corner grocery store for six years. She herself works at her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, oil, soaps, soda, cigarettes, bread, Tang, Maggi brand soups, juices, toilet paper, medicines, dairy products, and disposable products.

loans.use: stock her small grocery store.

loans.name: Otoniel De Los Reyes

texts.es: Otoniel es un hombre emprendedor de 35 años de edad, acompañado, con dos hijos, su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 20 años. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de inventario de granos básicos como quintal de arroz, azúcar, bidon de aceite, cajas de jabones, cajillas de gaseosas, golosinas, pollo, productos lácteos, etc.
texts.en: Otoniel is an enterprising man. He is 35 years old, lives with his partner, and has two children. He has run a small grocery store out of his home for twenty years. The loan that he is requesting will be used to buy inventory for his store, such as rice, sugar, oil, soaps, cases of sodas, candies, chicken, dairy products, and more.

loans.use: stock the small grocery he runs out of his home.

loans.name: Vidalia Del Carmen

texts.es: Vidalia es una mujer luchadora de 56 años de edad, soltera, con un hijo bajo su  cargo, su negocio es la venta de especie y hamburguesa desde hace 20 años, sus productos de especies los comercializa en Managua y norte del país, las hamburguesas las vende en su domicilio. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de clavo de olor, canela, cebada, semilla de jicaro, cacao, pimienta.
texts.en: Vidalia is a strong-spirited woman - she is 56 years old, single, with a child in her care.  Her business has been the sale of spices and hamburgers for 20 years.  Her spice products are sold in Managua and the north of the country, while the hamburgers are sold in her home.  She is requesting the loan for the purchase of clove, cinnamon, barley, jicaro seed, cocoa, and pepper.

loans.use: to purchase clove, cinnamon, barley, jicaro seed, cocoa, and pepper.

loans.name: Griselda Beatriz

texts.es: Griselda es una mujer emprendedora microempresaria, casada, con tres hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la venta de perecederos en el mercado  mayoreo de Managua desde hace 5 años, tiene a dos personas que le ayudan a vender. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de  pipián, ayote,  limón criollo, limón sin semilla, yuca rameña, manzanito, chilote, tomate.
texts.en: Griselda is an enterprising small business owner. She is married and has three children in her care. For the last five years, she has sold perishable foods in the wholesale market in Managua. She has two people who help her with her sales. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a wide variety of fruits and vegetables, including pipián and ayote (pumpkin-like squashes), two types of lime, yuca (a starchy tuber), baby apples, baby corn, and tomatoes.

loans.use: stock her fruit and vegetable market stall

loans.name: Isidora Del Socorro

texts.es: Isidora es una mujer microempresaria comerciante de 54 años de edad, acompañada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es venta de granos básicos en un tramo del mercado local de Masaya desde hace 34 años. Su compañero y una de sus hijas le ayudan en el negocio. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de arroz, azúcar, maíz, frijoles, bidón de aceite, bolsón de café toro,  cajas de salsa de tomate, sopa maggi, payana, harina, trigo, caja de jabón, cloro, mecate, purina, maní blanco, maní rojo.
texts.en: Isidora is both a saleswoman and a small business owner. She is 54 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children in her care. Her business for 34 years now is selling staple grains in a section of the local market of Masaya. Her partner and one of her daughters help her in this business. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rice, sugar, corn, beans, oil, Toro-brand coffee, boxes of tomato sauce, Maggi-brand soups, soy meat, white flour, wheat flour, boxes of soap, bleach, rope, dog food, and red and white peanuts.

loans.use: stock her sales stall with staple goods.

loans.name: Los Jirones Group

texts.es: Este grupo lo forman tres socias trabajadoras una de ellas es Casimira tiene la edad de 28 años, acompañada, con cuatros hijos bajo su cargo, su negocio es la agricultura y la venta de frutas desde hace 10 años. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de naranja, melón, sandía, plátanos por cien. Ella tiene de ser cliente de la institución 9 meses. María mujer de 28 años su negocio es una pulpería y Maribel mujer de 37 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos en pie.
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three hard-working members, one of whom is Casimira, 28. She is in a common-law marriage and has four children who she cares for. She has had a business in farming and selling fruits for 10 years.

She is requesting this loan to buy oranges, melons, watermelons, and bananas by the hundreds. She has been a member of this institution for nine months. Maria, 28, has a small grocery store and Maribel, 37, makes a living by raising and selling live pigs.

loans.use: to buy oranges, melons, watermelons, and bananas by the hundreds.

loans.name: Estoy Confiando Group

texts.es: Silvia es una de las tres integrantes del grupo estoy confiando ella tiene la edad de 35 años, casada, con dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de ropa ambulante en su comunidad y alrededores desde hace 3 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 1 ½ años. El crédito lo está solicitando nuevamente para la compra de faldas, trajes para niños, licras, blusas, camisas, pantalones. Zelenia tiene 27 años su negocio es la venta de nacatamales,cabeza de chancho, Victoria mujer de 54 años se dedica a la venta de sopa.
texts.en:
Silvia, 35, is one of the three members of Estoy Confiando Group.  She's married and has two children.  Her business for three years has been selling clothing as a street vendor in her community and the surrounding area.  She has been a client of the institution for a year and a half.

Silvia's loan is again to buy skirts, children's outfits, stretch pants, blouses, shirts, and pants.

Zelenia, 27, sells nacatamales [Nicaraguan-style tamales] and "cabeza de chancho" [a pork dish].  Victoria, 54, sells soup.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Reparto Andres Vega Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedoras y luchadoras una de ellas es María tiene la edad de 30 años, soltera, con cuatro hijos, su negocio es la venta de comida desde hace 3 años. Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 2 años.Tiempo que ha demostrado puntualidad en sus cuotas. Está solicitando nuevamente crédito para la compra de arroz, aceite, tortillas, carne, harina, repollo, tomate, chiltoma, cebolla, queso, plátanos, cremas, bolsas. Maritza tiene 28 años su negocio es la venta de calzado, Seneyda tiene 33 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
María is one member in a group made up of three enterprising and hardworking partners.  She is thirty years old and single, with four children.  For three years her business has been selling food.  She has been a client of the bank for two years.  In that time she has been punctual in her payments.  She is asking again for a loan to buy rice, oil, tortillas, meat, flour, cabbages, tomatoes, sweet peppers, onions, cheese, bananas, cream, and bags. 

Maritza is 28 years old.  Her business is shoe sales.

Seneyda is 33 years old.  She works making and selling tortillas.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, tortillas, meat, flour, cabbages, tomatoes, sweet peppers, onions, cheese, bananas, cream, and bags.

loans.name: Rios De Babilonia Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman tres socios muy trabajadores uno de ellos es María de los Santos tiene la edad de 30 años, casada, su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas, las distribuye a personas hondureñas desde hace 1 año. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de cosechas de tamarindo. Aura tiene la edad de 34 años su negocio es la elaboración de delantales, Víctor tiene 19 años su negocio es la venta de perecederos
texts.en:
This group is comprised of three very hard-working members. One of these members is Maria de los Santos. She is 30 years old, married, and has a business in buying and selling crops. She has been distributing these to Hondurans for one year.

She is requesting this loan to buy tamarindo crops. Aura, 34, has a business in making smocks and Victor, 19, has a business in selling perishable items.

loans.use: to buy tamarindo crops.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a repeat borrower aged 55. He is a married man with seven children. He applied for a loan of UGX 600,000 to help him improve his farming business.  

He has a challenge of low business turnover from the farming and low levels of purchases in the market, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to increase manpower so he can expand both his farm land and crops. This will increase his productivity and his livelihood in the long run.

loans.use: To hire labourers.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson wants to express his appreciation to the Kiva lenders for the good job they are doing. 

He is married and a bit elderly though he wants to keep active. This he does by grazing cows since he has enough farm land. He is however limited by capital resources. For this reason he is looking to Ugafode for a loan to help him purchase young bulls at a low price so he can fatten them and later sell them. He is hard working and honest.

loans.use: To buy baby bulls.

loans.name: Yeison Camilo

texts.es:
El es yeison Camilo  tiene 20 años, es de la cuidad de Bogotá, es el tercero de los hermanos, cuando empezó a crecer se dio cuenta de lo difícil que era la situación económica de la mama, el hermano mellizo y el hermano mayor  quien ya falleció. 
La mama tenía 40 años cuando él nació, el nombre era Graciela, quien también ya falleció, la mama trabajo en una empresa de flores de donde salió enferma, luego de trabajar muchos años en ella, debido a los químicos que manejaban en esa empresa  le dio una enfermedad que no tenia cura, él empezó a enfrentarse a una realidad de  preocupación y angustia por que el ver sufrir a la madre le impactaba mucho, y las diferencias  que ella vivía con el padre que nunca  ha vivido con ellos y  nunca le importó la vida de ellos.
Cuando él tenía 8 años, al hermano mayor falleció, para la mamá fue muy difícil enfrentarse a esta situación, después de esto ella lloraba todos los días, pero a pesar de todo ella fue muy fuerte y a los dos hijos mellizos los saco adelante en la primaria y el bachillerato antes de fallecer. 
Ellos han vivido la mayoría del tiempo en arriendo, para la mama le era muy difícil pagar el arriendo y el sustento de ellos, ella era una persona muy responsable con el pago de los recibos y hacia que le rindiera los pocos ingresos que tenia para sacarlos adelante a él y el  hermano.
La madre a ellos los  formó en valores y les decía que no se dejaran  influenciar por las malas amistades, que siempre había un límite y que ellos debían plantear parámetros. 
Gracias a los esfuerzos de la madre y con la mano de dios ellos terminaron el bachillerato, pues a pesar de las dificultades económicas de  la madre siempre  les enseño que la única forma de lograr una vida digna y buena era a través de la educación, que si no estudiaban les tocaría pasar muchas dificultades así como a ella le sucedió.
La madre falleció en el año 2010 y para el hermano mellizo y para él ha sido muy difícil superar la muerte de la única persona que los apoyaba emocionalmente y económicamente. 
Hace seis meses empezaron a estudiar en campo alto y  han tenido una sumatoria de valores agregados que se les han implantado allí, para ellos ha sido de gran ayuda estudiar en campo alto, han tenido un acercamiento en conocimientos los cuales los están motivando a tener metas que cumplir y culminar los estudios  con  entusiasmo y disciplina.
Se les ha dificultado en cuestión económica  el pago mensual de los estudios por eso ellos agradecen la colaboración de kiva para tener la posibilidad de un subsidio en la matricula.
texts.en:
Yeison Camilo is 20 and lives in the city of Bogotá.  He is one of three children and as he was growing up he realized how difficult the economic situation was for his mother, his twin brother and his eldest brother, who passed away.

His mother was 40 when he was born.  Her name was Graciela and she also passed away.  She used to work for a flower company but became ill after working there a long time.  The chemicals she handled in the company were blamed for her illness which had no cure.  Yeison Camilo had to face reality and became worried and anxious on seeing how much his mother suffered.  She also had a bad relationship with his father who never lived with them and never cared for them.

When he was eight years old, his eldest brother died.  It was difficult for his mother to face this situation and she would weep every day.  But she was very strong and able to provide for her twin boys, getting them through grade school and high school before she died.

Most of their lives, they lived in rental property and it was hard for his mother to pay the rent and support the children.  She was very responsible and paid the bills and stretched her income to support the two boys.  She gave them values and told them never to let bad friendships influence them.  There was a limit and they had to establish the parameters.

Thanks to his mother's efforts and God's help, they were able to finish high school.  Despite the economic difficulties, their mother always taught them how to lead a decent life through education, which she believed would make life easier.  

Yeison Camilo's mother passed away in 2010, and it has been very difficult for him and his twin brother to overcome the death of the only person who supported them both emotionally and economically.

Six months ago they began their university studies which has given them even more values.  The access to knowledge motivates them to go on to finish a career with enthusiasm and discipline.

The monthly payment of school tuition has become difficult though, so they are grateful to Kiva for a loan to pay for tuition.

loans.use: To pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Lluvia De Amor Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cuatro socias luchadoras una de ellas es Ninoska tiene la edad de 28 años, acompañda, con dos hijos, su negocio es la venta de artesanía, plantas de rosas, caramelos desde hace 9 años, sus productos los comercializa en los diferentes departamentos como Boaco, Granada. Tiene 5 años de ser cliente de la institución, El crédito lo solicita para la compra de artesanía de luna, sol, jarrones, plantas de rosa, churros, trocantes, caramelos rayados, leche de burra. Waleska tiene 25 años se dedica a la venta de artesanía, plantas y caramelos, Xiomara mujer de 45 años su negocio es la venta de artesanía, plantas, caramelos, Luisa mujer de 56 años se dedica a la venta de artesanía.
texts.en:
This group is formed of four hard-working members. One of whom is Ninoska, age 28. She has a partner and two children, and her line of work for the last nine years is selling crafts, rose plants, and caramels. She sells her products in various departments such as Boaco, Granada. She is in her fifth year as a member of the institution. The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy moon and sun crafts, vases, roses, churros, sweets, and donkey milk. 

Waleska has 25 years experience in the business of selling crafts, plants, and candies.
Xiomara, 45 years old, sells crafts, plants, and candies.
Luisa, 56 years old, sells handicrafts.

loans.use: buy crafts, rose plants, and candies for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with seven children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a pub in the market. She has been in this business for some years. She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of UGX 900,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy crates of beer, soda, local gin and spirits. She generates additional income from a food stall.
