All their children attend school.

Manju has sold various products (personnel care items, soap, clothes, slippers, etc.) from hers shop for six years. This will be her first loan with the field partner People's Forum. She plans to use her portion of this loan to increase her working capital and buy slippers, personnel care products and clothing. She will then sell these products to increase her earnings.

In the coming years, Manju would like to build a solid and long-lasting house, buy bicycles and provide for her children's schooling.

loans.use: To purchase slippers, personnel care products and clothing for retail.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a high population area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to buy more stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy greater quantities of charcoal. Her business goal is to own a retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a successful business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Ousmane

texts.fr:
Ousmane, un jeune de 30 ans est agent de développement  de profession. Il s’active dans la vente de denrées alimentaires depuis plus de 5 ans. Il exploite un espace dans la maison où il a ouvert une boutique. Ousmane est un habitué du guichet et ce renouvellement lui permettra d’acheter du riz, de l’huile, du savon, du lait… pour mettre dans sa boutique. Pour les charges, il appuie les dépenses de sa mère et de ses frères et sœurs parce qu’il est célibataire sans enfant. 
Ousmane est un jeune très ambitieux qui désire agrandir et diversifier son activité. Il veut faire de l’aviculture et augmenter son espace commerciale. Il a aussi comme projet, de construire un bâtiment et de le mettre en location ce qui augmenterai ses revenus et permettra de mettre à l’aise sa famille
texts.en:
Ousmane, age 30, is a development officer by trade. He has been selling foodstuffs for over 5 years. He conducts his sales out of his home where he uses a particular area as a store. Ousmane is a frequent borrower with this branch, and this loan renewal will allow him to buy rice, oil, soap, milk, etc. to stock his store. Being a single man without children, he helps with the expenses of his mother and siblings. 

Ousmane is very ambitious. He wants to bolster and diversify his activities. He would like to launch a poultry farming business and expand his commercial premises. He also wants to build a rental property to bolster his income and provide for his family’s well-being.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell in his store.

loans.name: Katherime Rosalinda

texts.es:
Katherime es un joven con mucho entusiasmo, vive en la ciudad de Sayan, y trabaja como asistente en centro pre-universitario de su ciudad, lo cual le permite tener ingresos para poder seguir adelante.

Katherime esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo Katherime podrá comprar unos audífonos especiales para la sordera, para su abuela, de esta manera ella podrá seguir adelante y sobre todo poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su abuela.
texts.en:
Katherime is a young woman with much enthusiasm. She lives in the city of Sayan and works as an assistant in a pre-university center in her city. This allows her to have sufficient income to forge ahead.

Katherime is grateful for Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help, Katherime will be able to purchase special hearing aids to address her grandmother's deafness. In this manner, Katherime will be able to continue advancing and, above all, offer her grandmother a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy hearing aids for her grandmother's deafness.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar is 38 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in Vanadzor in Lori region. Gohar operates her own business selling clothes. She rents a shop where she sells women's clothes, underwear, shoes, and boots. Her husband helps her very much by driving to Georgia and bringing back large assortments of woman shoes and winter boots. He also drives to Yerevan and brings clothes from there. 

Gohar is not novice in selling and she knows how to attract customers and have a good sale during a day. Gohar is very polite and patient with her customers and she is always ready to give advice and help them with correct choice of clothes or shoes.  Gohar is requesting her second loan for 1,000,000 Armenian drams, which she will use to renew her shop’s clothes and shoes assortment.

loans.use: to renew her shop’s clothes and shoes assortment for the winter season
